Package model.players

Class GamePlayer

java.lang.Object
model.players.GamePlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<GamePlayer>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Goalkeeper, Striker
public class GamePlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<GamePlayer>
The GamePlayer class represents a soccer player in the game. Each player has a color, name, statistics, and position.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.lang.String playerName

  • Field Details

    • playerName

      public final java.lang.String playerName
      The name of the player

    • playerStatistics

      public PlayerStatistics playerStatistics
      The statistics of the player. (Could either be saves or goals)

  • Constructor Details

    • GamePlayer

      public GamePlayer​(java.lang.String name, java.awt.Color color)
      Creates a player with a specified name and color. At creation the player does not possess the ball, and does not have any statistics
      Parameters:
      name - - the name of the player
      color - - the color of the player

  • Method Details

    • getPlayerPosition

      public java.awt.Point getPlayerPosition()
      Returns the position of the player
      Returns:
      A Point representing the players position

    • isPlayerHasBall

      public boolean isPlayerHasBall()
      Returns a Boolean representation of the players possession. A GamePLayer is in possession of the ball if the ball is within 55 radius
      Returns:
      True if the player has the ball, false otherwise

    • moveLeft

      Moves the player in the -x direction

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(GamePlayer o)
      Compares two players based on their names
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<GamePlayer>
      Returns:
      A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the specified GamePlayer is greater than, equal to, or less than this GamePlayer, ignoring case considerations.
